page.title: 12Village stand-points
page.content: We found six pumps in our village. They were put in by the County Council and later taken over by the Anglian Water Board.They are about 50 years old and are about one metre tall.They freeze up in winter time.Their real names are{stand points}because when people wanted water they would go and stand there with their buckets and turn the handle for the water to flow. The last one went out of use in 1984 in Potters Cross and was taken to the Anglia Water Board, renovated and placed in their reception area. A man at Keysoe in north Bedfordshire still uses an identical pump to the ones in Wootton,and when his breaks down,they have to take the spare parts from the ones not used in the district.The pumps have a lion on them ,with its mouth open where the water comes out.
